Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which U.S. companies are moving into Mexico compared to other places.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that U.S. companies are moving into Mexico more than almost any other place.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the movement of U.S. companies into Mexico is the primary reason for losing industry and business, without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: Experts suggest that China, rather than Mexico, is the top outsourcing destination for U.S. companies, indicating an alternative explanation to the claim.
